tourName: Shanghai, Hangzhou and Suzhou bullet train tour
generalInfo: Discover the timeless elegance of eastern China on this immersive 7-day private cultural journey through Shanghai, Hangzhou, and Suzhou—three cities that embody the perfect harmony of tradition and modernity. Begin in cosmopolitan Shanghai, where colonial-era grandeur along the Bund meets futuristic skylines at the Shanghai Tower. Wander through the classical Yu Garden, explore the leafy lanes of the Former French Concession, and uncover local life in the labyrinthine alleys of Tianzifang. Then, glide effortlessly to Hangzhou aboard a high-speed train to experience the poetic beauty of West Lake, a UNESCO World Heritage Site that has inspired artists for centuries. In Meijiawu Tea Village, meet local farmers, pick your own Dragon Well tea leaves, and learn the art of traditional stir-frying and brewing. The next day, witness Hangzhou’s innovative spirit at the Alibaba Creative Park and a vibrant local market before heading to Suzhou—the “Venice of the East.” Here, stroll through the exquisite Master of the Nets Garden, a masterpiece of classical Chinese landscape design, and wander Pingjiang Road’s ancient canals lined with teahouses and silk shops. Cap off your journey with a serene boat ride through Tongli Water Town, where stone bridges and whitewashed houses reflect centuries of Jiangnan charm. Designed with thoughtful pacing and authentic encounters, this tour blends luxury, culture, and sustainability: stay in handpicked boutique hotels, enjoy meals at local favorites (including Michelin-recommended spots), and travel with knowledgeable local guides who bring each destination to life. More than a sightseeing trip, this is an invitation to experience the soul of China’s most refined cultural corridor—where every garden, canal, and cup of tea tells a story of grace, resilience, and enduring beauty.

dayInfo.description: Arrive in Shanghai, Your private guide will be waiting for you at the airport arrivals hall or train station. An experienced driver with a comfortable vehicle (non-smoking) will be ready to escort you to your hotel. Your guide will help with your hotel check-in. Have a good rest to prepare for your trip the next day.

Shanghai (B, L). Begin your journey by soaring to the summit of an iconic skyscraper at the Shanghai Tower. Next, feel the pulse of Shanghai on a public ferry cruise along the legendary Huangpu River. Step ashore and wander amidst the Bund's captivating streetscapes, each building a silent storyteller. Then, let curiosity guide you down a hidden alleyway, where the true essence of local life thrives. Here, you'll savor exquisite local bites from a Michelin-starred spot. Next, immerse yourself in the timeless beauty of Yu Garden. Visiting Shanghai Museum East is a fusion of art, culture, and modern architecture.

Shanghai (B, L). Step back in time and immerse yourself in the enchanting Former French Concession. Explore Shanghai's cultural heritage on the Xujiahui City Walk. This serene route highlights history, art, and local life—from the Xu Guangqi Tomb and Xujiahui Academy to the Gothic Catholic Church, Xujiahui Park, and Little Red House, birthplace of China's national anthem. Finally, Tianzifang. A stroll through Shanghai's old alleys near Tianzifang offers a unique glimpse into the city's traditional culture and timeless charm.

Shanghai to Hangzhou (B, L). Today, you will take a 45-minute high speed train from Shanghai to Hangzhou. Then you will visit the West Lake first. Journey to Meijiawu Tea Village, the birthplace of China's renowned West Lake Dragon Well tea. Learn to select and pick tea leaves correctly. Then, observe the stir-frying process, which dehydrates the leaves and preserves their vibrant green. Conclude by mastering the art of brewing a perfect cup of this legendary tea. Then we head to a living museum of Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM). Except learning the history and principles of TCM, you can see experienced pharmaceutical workers demonstrating the art of manual pill-making, slicing herbs, and compounding prescriptions using ancient tools. Qing He Fang Old Street is not a vibrant and historically significant area, but also a paradise for foodies.

Hangzhou (B, L). Step into a popular local market—more than a marketplace, it's a living gallery of Hangzhou life. Wander past stalls bursting with fresh produce, savor local snacks, and feel the city's authentic energy. Then, board a driverless "bus from the future," where the wheel moves on its own and the ride glides effortlessly through the streets. Arrive at the Alibaba Creative Ecological Park, once the heart of the tech giant. Discover how Alibaba and Hangzhou grew together, shaping a spirit of innovation that still defines the city. The Hangzhou Urban Planning Exhibition Hall showcases the city's past, present, and future with immersive VR/AR displays, highlighting its vision as a "livable, innovative, and humanistic" city. Nearby, the City Balcony offers sweeping views of the Qiantang River, Olympic Sports Center, and Hangzhou Century Center.

Hangzhou to Suzhou (B, L). Embark on a scenic 1.5-hour drive from Hangzhou to Suzhou, covering a distance of approximately 162 kilometers. Though not as sprawling as the Humble Administrator's Garden, the Master-of-Nets Garden offers an unparalleled sense of intimacy and delicate beauty. Then visit Pingjiang Road. In the afternoon, visit the Tongli Water Town, a picturesque destination steeped in history dating back over a millennium. Explore its network of canals, adorned with historic bridges that connect charming islands.

Suzhou to Shanghai (B). As your journey comes to a close, your dedicated guide and driver will escort you from Suzhou to the Shanghai airport, ensuring a smooth departure. We look forward to welcoming you back for another unforgettable adventure in China.
